Profiling/Conditional Text menu in Author Mode

body.p: The Profiling / Conditional Text drop-down menu (available on the toolbar) allows you to select some settings for how profiled content is shown in the editor. It also displays a list of the profiling conditions sets that are defined in the current framework, and it includes an option that opens a preferences page where you can define and configure profiling attributes and condition sets.

The Profiling / Conditional Text drop-down menu includes the following:
Show Profiling Colors and Styles Select this option to turn on conditional colors and styling. You can specify whether or not this option is selected by default at startup in the Profiling/Conditional Text Colors and Styles preferences page.
Show Profiling Attributes Select this option to turn on conditional text markers. They are displayed at the end of conditional text blocks, as a list of attribute name and their currently set values. You can specify whether or not this option is selected by default at startup in the
Profiling/Conditional Text Attributes Rendering preferences page.
Show Excluded Content Controls if the content filtered out by a particular condition set is hidden or grayed-out in the editor area and in the Outline and DITA Maps Manager views. When this option is selected, the content filtered by the currently applied condition set is grayed-out. To show only the content that matches the currently applied condition set, deselect this option. You can specify whether or not this option is selected by default at startup in the Profiling/Conditional Text preferences page.To remind you that document content is hidden, displays labels showing the currently applied condition set. These labels are displayed in the Author mode editing area, the Outline view and DITA Maps Manager view. Right-click any of the labels to quickly access the Show Excluded Content action.
List of all profiling condition sets that match the current document type Click a condition set entry to activate it.
Profiling Settings Opens the Profiling/Conditional Text preferences page, where you can manage profiling attributes and profiling conditions sets. You can also configure the profiling styles and colors options from the Profiling/Conditional Text Colors and Styles preferences page and the Profiling/Conditional Text Attributes Rendering preferences page.

All these settings are associated with the current project and are restored each time you open it. For a new project, all Profiling/Conditional Text menu actions states are reset to their default values.
